children.subject: Take my opinion with a grain of salt, but the best course of action is probably to take EE 127/227A, and then self-study through a text like Convex Optimization. However this does only provide you with a surface level understanding of optimization and a great deal of mathematical analysis is necessary to fully understand the content in the aforementioned text. If you wish to go into deep learning, this level of math might be sufficient (only topic I can think of right now potentially missing is information theory). However if you wish to do topics outside of deep learning, the amount of math probably isn't enough. Consider also taking courses in statistics and analysis if you haven't yet.

history.content:
EE 227AT vs. EE 227BT vs. EE 227C?

Should I take all three eventually if I want to know the math behind ML?
history.subject: which is more useful for machine learning?
